qas.question: What was the name of the period before the Heian era?
The Heian period began in what year?
What warrior class rose during the Heian era?
Heian-kyo is now what present-day city?
What was the name of the emperor who moved Japan's capital to Heian?
When did the Nara period begin?
Where was the capital of Japan prior to 794 A.D.?
Where did Emperor Kanmu try to move the capital after Heian-kyo?

plausible_answers.text: considered a high point in Japanese culture

qas.question: Why have later generations always admired the Nara period?
What class declined in the Heian-kyo period?

context: The Heian period was preceded by the <a0_0><b6_0>Nara<b6_0/><a0_0/> period and began in <a1_0><b5_0>794 A.D<b5_0/><a1_0/> after the movement of the capital of Japan to Heian-kyō (present day <a3_0>Kyōto<a3_0/>京都), by the 50th emperor, Emperor <a4_0>Kanmu<a4_0/>. Kanmu first tried to move the capital to <b7_0>Nagaoka-kyō<b7_0/>, but a series of disasters befell the city, prompting the emperor to relocate the capital a second time, to Heian. The Heian Period is <b8_0>considered a high point in Japanese culture<b8_0/> that later generations have always admired. The period is also noted for the rise of the <a2_0><b9_0>samurai<a2_0/> class,<b9_0/> which would eventually take power and start the feudal period of Japan.
